sect1.title: GRAPH

row.entry: The initial set of records to process.
The number of times to call the processor function.
The function attribute to process the input. This function may use the following as arguments:

entry.programlisting:
ROWSET ROWSET (LEFT) ROWSET(LEFT) Specifies the set of input datasets, which may be indexed to specify the result set from any specific iteration — ROWSET(LEFT)[0] indicates the initial input recordset while ROWSET(LEFT)[1] indicates the result set from the first iteration. This may also be used as the first parameter to the RANGE function to specify a set of datasets (allowing the graph to efficiently process N-ary merge/join N-ary merge/join
arguments).
COUNTER COUNTER Specifies an INTEGER parameter for the graph iteration number.

row.entry: GRAPH returns the record set result of the last of the iterations.

sect1.para: The GRAPH function is similar to the LOOP function LOOP function , but it executes as though all the iterations of the processor call were expanded out, removing any branches that can't be executed, and then joined together. The resulting graph is as efficient as if the graph had been expanded out by hand.
